content.rendered:
VCF division

Hugues Fourmentraux, born in 1967, holds an engineering degree from the Ecole Nationale Supérieure des Arts et Métiers. He began his career as a works engineer with Spie Citra.

He joined VINCI in 1995, serving successively as works engineer, chief engineer, works director, operations director and then building activities director at Sogea Nord between 2001 and 2005.  He then moved from the Nord to the Rhône-Alpes region, where he joined Lamy as Deputy Director.

He joined Sogea Nord-Ouest in 2007 and was appointed head of the Normandy region building division when it was set up in 2008. He became head of the VINCI Construction France Normandie Centre delegation in 2010.

He was named Operations Director, Grand Ouest at VINCI Construction France in 2011 and Deputy Managing Director in 2013.

Hugues Fourmentraux was appointed Managing Director of VINCI Construction France in July 2015 and Chairman in January 2016.

As of 2021, Hugues Fourmentraux heads the VCF division within the VINCI Construction pole.

excerpt.rendered: As of 2021, Hugues Fourmentraux heads the VCF division within the VINCI Construction pole.
